snippet: An application to review an Islamic law that bars Muslim men from dressing as women was rejected on Thursday, raising fears that transgender people could face increasing prosecutions.
abstract: Malaysian court dismisses challenge to law barring Muslim men from dressing or posing as women, prompting concern that more transgender people in the Muslim-majority country may be prosecuted.
lead_paragraph: An application to review an Islamic law that bars Muslim men from dressing as women was rejected on Thursday, raising fears that transgender people could face increasing prosecutions.

headline.seo: Malaysian Court Rejects Challenge to Cross-Dressing Ban
headline.main: Malaysian Court Rejects Challenge to Cross-Dressing Ban
